Alpha Knights

twitter • facebook • instagram

ABOUT US

who are we?

We are the Alpha Knights, a first-time FIRST Robotics team based in San Marcos High School, California — Team 6695. Our team is composed of the very best programmers, artists, leaders, and hardware experts at our school. Together, our goal is not only to win — but to gain valuable experience and bond together over time.

And here's a wonderful video that explains who we are more in-depth.

THE TEAM

meet the Alpha Knights

Michael Maddy

Vice-President

Michael Maddy is a junior and is 16 years old. He has participated in robotics club for 3 years and is one of the vice presidents. He has experience in Java development and dabbles in web development. As a child, he was always interested in electronics, cables and pipes. Now he plans to major in Computer Science or Engineering.

Jeremy Millard

Vice-President, Hardware, Software

Jeremy is 17 and a senior. He’s been a part of the SMHS robotics club for all four years of high school. Jeremy also owns a Minecraft server called DiamondFire, where players build their own games using a scripting language he created. He’s grown the server into a profitable business, with sales in over 35 countries. Jeremy plans to major in Computer Science.

TJ Horner

Web Development, Social Media, Open Source Enthusiast

TJ is a 16-year-old sophomore. In his free time, he likes building cool software projects and whatnot. Professionally, he has interned for StudentRND since middle school. StudentRND is a nonprofit whose goal is to get students to take the first step into the programming world; StudentRND also runs an event called CodeDay — a 24-hour programming marathon geared toward beginners. He plans to major in Computer Science. He also made this website!

Connor Myers

Web Development

Connor Myers is a 16 year junior in high school. Connor has been with the robotics for little over half a year. He has programmed in a vast amount of languages such as C, C++, Java, Python, HTML and various other programming languages. As a child, Connor had always wanted to work with computers. Connor plans to major in Computer Science at a four year university.

Mary Anne Lee

Marketing, Social Media

Mary Anne is 17 and a senior. She is captain of Academic League and Math Club at San Marcos High School, and has been involved with international and national piano competition since the age of 5. She plans to attend a 4 year university and major in molecular biology in the near future.

Alexander Garcia

Software

Alexander Garcia is a 16 year old and is a junior. He is a computer programmer who has experience in Java, Swift, C#, and messes with web development. He is a newcomer to the robotics club and has put his computer programming and engineering skills to the test. When he was little, he was always learning new things about computers and enjoyed tinkering with them. Alexander plans to major in Computer Science.

David Caccavo

David is 16 years old and is a junior. He plays lacrosse and is VP of Politics Club at SMHS. David has taken the opportunity to grow throughout his high school career. He is a member of the Simon Scholar Foundation and plans on attending a four-year university. Although this is his first year doing Robotics, he is trying to do anything he can to support the team.

Bryan Gonzalez

Hardware

Bryan Gonzalez is a 17 year old Junior. He is new to the Robotics Team and is still learning about the robotics.

Daniel Plue

Hardware

Daniel is 17 and a senior. He is a captain of the lacrosse team and plans to major in mechanical engineering at a 4 year university.

Vinh Tran

Field Events

Vinh Tran is a 15 year old sophomore. He is a member of the San Marcos High School Surf Team, and participated in and outside robotics class involving both coding and building for several years. Vinh plans to major in Computer Science and Mechanical Engineering. He hopes to learn new skills and useful knowledge by participating in the FRC.

Josh Volpe

Field Events

Josh Volpe is 17 and is a junior. He has been a member of the Knight Regiment Front Ensemble for three years. Through his time in band he has learned the importance of teamwork, time management, and dedication.

Vincent Le

Field Events

Vincent Le is 17 and is a Junior. He enjoys playing osu! and is experiencing his first time in a robotics team. He plans to work in the computer industry when he leaves high school and possibly design games if given a chance.
